Sample App

Project Workflow for Smaller Projects and Static Websites

This workflow uses a Live Server extension to serve the current project in the browser. Changes to projects files are served in real time in the browser. 'Index.html' is located within the project's 'dist' folder. Sass is written into 'main.scss', contained within the 'scss' folder. A Sass Compiler compiles Sass into 'main.min.css' file within dist--css. JavaScript is written in a main.js file saved in dist--js folder.

Extensions to use with VS Code

Live Server by Ritwick Dey

Live Sass Compiler by Ritwick Dey

HTML CSS Support by ecmel, primarily for html and css class and id attribute completion. Also good for offering up remote css classes such as Bootstrap by linking in settings.

Auto Rename Tag by Jun Han, good for autorenaming tag pairs.

Prettier code formatter to tidy up badly formatted code, set to prettify on save. Will remedy things like, missing semi-colons, badly rabbed items and moves all double quotes to single.

JavaScript (ES6) Code Snippets, ,so now we can use 'clg' as a shortcut to console.log

Indent Rainbow by oderwat, just makes indentation easier to read

Git Lens within current project, go to terminal (option `), git init (return), git add . && git commit -m 'Initial commit' (return).
